nodes.text: Taarja was a spoken trade language that was used in the galaxy. Around 34 ABY, Taarja was spoken by the alien Yasto Attsmun while on board the yacht Undisputed Victor as it sailed away from Canto Bight on the planet Cantonica.

The Chiss Ascendancy used Taarja to communicate with the Paccosh during a Mission to the Rapacc system in about 19 BBY. Chiss caregiver Mitth'ali'astov did not like to speak Taarja, but was capable nevertheless. She described the sounds of the language as "angular".

In the Star Wars canon, Taarja first appeared in the 2017 film Star Wars: Episode VIII The Last Jedi. It was first identified in the Star Wars By the Numbers video "Every Language in Star Wars Movies," which was posted on the Star Wars Kids YouTube channel in 2019.
In the Star Wars Legends continuity, Taarja was a trade language that first appeared in the 2006 novel Outbound Flight, by Timothy Zahn.
